label: 散所
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 3:  Medieval Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1990
説明文: Literally, scattered places." A term originating in the late Heian period to distinguish the scattered possessions from the main resident and headquarters (honjo) of a shōen proprietor. In the Kamakura period, the nonagricultural areas of a shōen. The service population congregated in these areas and were themselves often called sanjo.　[本所、荘園]　"
